howtoinvestfordummies.model

Interface IPortfolio

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Portfolio

    public interface IPortfolio
    Represents common interface dedicated for portfolio related operations. After the portfolio is created, user may wish to find certain details which are already present or calculated as per request.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IPortfolio addInvestments(IInvestment investment)
      Adds investment object in the existing list of portfolios and returns the newly updated Portfolio.
      double getCostBasis(java.util.Date date)
      This method returns the total cost of investment made by user in this portfolio.
      java.util.List<IInvestment> getInvestments()
      This method returns list of investments.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the unique name of portfolio in String.
      double getValue(java.util.Date date)
      This method returns the total value of the portfolio up to the given date.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the unique name of portfolio in String.
        Returns:
        name designated for the requested portfolio.

      • getValue

        double getValue(java.util.Date date)
        This method returns the total value of the portfolio up to the given date. It should return the sum of the latest value up to 2 digits specified for the date for the all the investments present in the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        date - in Date for which values needs to be fetched.
        Returns:
        value containing total portfolio value for the specified date.

      • getCostBasis

        double getCostBasis(java.util.Date date)
        This method returns the total cost of investment made by user in this portfolio. It therefore sums up all the investment cost values and returns the final values.
        Parameters:
        date - in Date for which cost of investment needs to be fetched.
        Returns:
        cost representing total portfolio cost up to the specified date.

      • addInvestments

        IPortfolio addInvestments(IInvestment investment)
        Adds investment object in the existing list of portfolios and returns the newly updated Portfolio.
        Parameters:
        investment - of type IInvestment containing Investment object that needs to be added.
        Returns:
        portfolio of type IPortfolio consisting of updated portfolio.

      • getInvestments

        java.util.List<IInvestment> getInvestments()
        This method returns list of investments. The implementation should ensure that the investment list is not updatable.
        Returns:
        investmentList containing existing investments in the portfolio.
